intro: Sorocea pubivena subsp. pubivena, commonly known as the hairy sorocea, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and are covered with fine, short hairs, giving the plant its common name. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
